elevatedvision.name: Elevated Vision
elevatedvision.settings.shading-algorith: Set the default shadow method for new scenes. Can adjust per-scene using the scene configuration. Polygons: Represent shadows caused by limited-height walls using polygons for token vision. WebGL: Use WebGL for light shadows and token vision caused by limited height walls. In addition, use WebGL to shade canvas areas for lights and token vision where terrain is higher than the light or token vision respectively. Enables directional lighting.
elevatedvision.settings.elevationmin.hin: Default elevation minimum for new scenes. Can adjust per-scene using the scene configuration.
elevatedvision.settings.elevationstep.hi: Default elevation increment for new scenes. Can adjust per-scene using the scene configuration.
elevatedvision.settings.point-light-size: Default radius of the physical light sphere. Foundry default treats lights as point sources (0-sized). Larger values create larger shadow penumbra.
elevatedvision.settings.auto-change-elev: Set the default automatic token method for new scenes. Can adjust per-scene using the scene configuration. If enabled, will automatically adjust token elevation based on elevation layer data. Token elevation is only adjusted if the token is currently 'on the ground', meaning the token's starting elevation equals the terrain elevation.
elevatedvision.settings.elevation-measur: When measuring token elevation, how many points within the token shape to use for the calculation? Single Point is most performant; averaging all is least performant. Clustered places points at 10% of the token width/height around the center; spread uses the Foundry default 25% instead. Averaging skips points at regular intervals to create a grid of points over the entire token shape.
elevatedvision.settings.enhance-cw-sweep: Experimental. Uses the fill algorithm to provide a potential speed-up to the line-of-sight calculation used by vision, sound, and lighting. When the token or source is completely enclosed by a set of walls, this allows sweep to shortcut various calculations. Requires additional calculations when walls are created, updated, or destroyed. May be useful for very large dungeon scenes.
elevatedvision.settings.add-fly-button.h: Add a control to the token toolbar that can be enabled or disabled to tell Elevated Vision when a token should be considered capable of flight. When the control is enabled, automatic token elevation will keep tokens above the ground when moved off a terrain or tile cliff greater than the token height.
elevatedvision.settings.brush-size.name: Fill by Pixel Brush Size
elevatedvision.settings.brush-size.hint: Set the size of the Fill by Pixel brush.
elevatedvision.settings.color-min.name: Elevation Minimum Color
elevatedvision.settings.color-min.hint: Set the color used to display the minimum elevation (above the scene minimum) on the elevation layer.
elevatedvision.settings.color-max.name: Elevation Maximum Color
elevatedvision.settings.color-max.hint: Set the color used to display the maximum elevation on the elevation layer. Colors between min and max will be interpolated.
elevatedvision.settings.color-min.string: Set the color used to display the minimum elevation (above the scene minimum) on the elevation layer. Install the Color Picker module to get a color picker here.
elevatedvision.settings.color-max.string: Set the color used to display the maximum elevation on the elevation layer. Colors between min and max will be interpolated. Install the Color Picker module to get a color picker here.
elevatedvision.settings.lights-full-penu: When enabled, lighting for all walls will display a full penumbra for the shadow. When disabled, the penumbra shadow for infinite-height walls may display differently than the shadow for limited-height walls. Disabling may improve compatibility with other modules. Only applies when WebGL shadows are enabled.
When enabled, Elevated Vision will override the Foundry default visibility testing. This is necessary if you want token visibility to work with directional lighting, limited height walls, or with the Full Shadow Penumbra setting. Disable if some other module is taking over visibility testing.

elevatedvision.sceneconfig.elevationstep: Elevation steps (increments) permitted in this scene. Maximum elevation for a scene equals minimum + 255 * increment.
elevatedvision.sceneconfig.autoelevate.h: When enabled, tokens automatically adjust elevation based on elevation layer data when moving. Token elevation is only adjusted if the token is currently 'on the ground.'
elevatedvision.sceneconfig.shading-algor: Polygons: Represent shadows caused by limited-height walls using polygons for token vision. WebGL: Use WebGL for light shadows and token vision caused by limited height walls. In addition, use WebGL to shade canvas areas for lights and token vision where terrain is higher than the light or token vision respectively. Enables directional lighting for the scene.
elevatedvision.ambientconfig.lightSize.h: Radius of the physical light sphere. Foundry default treats lights as point sources (0-sized). Larger values create larger shadow penumbra.
elevatedvision.ambientconfig.directional: Treat this light like a sun or moon—--placed at a given direction and angle above the horizon. Requires WebGL shadows.
elevatedvision.ambientconfig.azimuth.hin: Canvas X/Y direction from which the directional light appears along the horizon. 0º is due east; 90º is due south. The location of this light on the canvas determines its azimuth.
elevatedvision.ambientconfig.elevationAn: Angle of the directional light above the horizon. 90º is directly overhead, and results in no shadows. Distance of this light from the canvas center controls elevation angle; the elevation angle increases as the light approaches the center.
Controls the amount of the penumbra (the fuzzy area) in the wall shadow. Approximates the angle of the directional light as seen at the canvas level. A smaller angle results in a smaller penumbra.
elevatedvision.tileconfig.elevation.name: Elevation
elevatedvision.tileconfig.elevation.hint: Elevation of this tile. If Levels module is active, this will be linked to the bottom tile elevation for Levels. If elevation is finite, it will override terrain elevation at that point if the token is on or above the tile.
elevatedvision.tokenconfig.elevation-alg: How many points within the token shape to use when automatically adjusting token elevation?
